lines.text: You're the Giant in the story of Jack and the Beanstalk, aren't you?
Well, yes.
And the Giant in the story of Jack and the Beanstalk wasn't after no wabbit, now was he? He was after Jack. Right?
Well, I guess maybe that is wight.
All right then.
[Pointing to Daffy]
He is Jack.
It's a lie. It's a lie. My name is, uh, Aloysius. His name is Jack. Jack Rabbit.
Oh, no. You're Jack, all right.
I am not. You're Jack.
You are Jack and you know it, because it is a fact.
I guess I'll have to open up with a pair of Jacks.
I'll gwind yer bones to make me bwead.

[Holding a pepper mill]
This ought to gwind their bones vewy nicewy.
Boy, this is the kind of story I like. I can just taste all those pieces of eight. And doubloons. And triploons. And, uh, quadruploons. And, uh, uh, quintuploons.
Keep your hands off me. I came here for those solid-gold goodies, and I ain't leaving without them. On account of I am greedy.
Odds my bodkins, a beanstalk. And all the way up to the sky too. Well, I better get to work climbing this thing or we won't have any picture.
You could've stood up for your rights, you know? You milk-sop!
[first lines]
Now there goes a salesman. He trades me out of a perfectly good, grade A, homogenized Holstein cow, and for what? Three stupid beans! Jack, you're a jerk!
[last lines]
Tick tock. Tick tock. Tick tock. Tick tock. Eh, it's a living. Tick tock. Tick tock.
I don't remember any rabbit in Jack and the Beanstalk. But, there's gonna be one in this one.
I smell the bwood of an Engwish wabbit.
